00 response. However, it does indicate that the selection can

generated (possibly hype=
rtext) menu."[1]

 (e.g. HTML

<a hre=
f=3D"...">Pie char</a>
<a href=3D"...">Data Table</a>

List</a>

Since the HTML A tag has "type" as an optional "typoe" attribute[=
2],
the same content can be modified to help client applications make

ated choices.

xt List</a>

Finally, since the HTTP 1.1 spec also indicates the informatio=
n could
be carried in a header, the new Web Linking spec[3] could be used a=

guide for returning the same information as Link Headers:

 last option works well for clients that are not expecting an HTML

 body (e.g. image viewers that want to negotiate for a
